newsitem.title: FRANCE: European ombudsman opens office in Strasbourg.
newsitem.headline: European ombudsman opens office in Strasbourg.

text.p: European Union citizens with complaints about maladministration by EU institutions can now turn to the European ombudsman, whose office was formally opened in Strasbourg on Tuesday.
Jacob Soderman, the EU's first ombudsman, began work on petitions from disgruntled citizens 18 months ago but has only now received a permanent headquarters, in the European Parliament.
Since September 1995, Soderman has received over 1,400 complaints, dealt with 104 and launched investigations into a further 159.
So far his inquiries have confirmed evidence of maladministration in only 34 cases, which have led to requests to the institutions concerned to rectify the situation.
The creation of the ombudsman's office was designed to underline the EU's commitment to open, democratic and accountable administration.
